narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: further developed the ability to read/write/ and speak Spanish.
Improved my ability to read and understand Spanish.
Even though the class was in a virtual setting, I felt like my Spanish speaking skills improved as much as they would have in an in-person setting.
Increased proficiency in Spanish speaking, writing, and reading skills.

I improved all of my Spanish skills including writing, listening, and speaking. I also learned a lot about Latin American culture and history through first-person narratives and stories that we read in class. I can speak with more confidence and more fluidity than ever.

I learned various vocabulary terms about different topics such as vacations, the environment, and emotions and moods. Additionally, I learned how to conjugate and use the preterite, imperfect, future, present, and imperfect and present subjunctive.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: All levels of language so far have been fun but online definitely made learning how to speak more challenging due to lack of opportunity. Maybe incorporating more speaking activities would help improve that aspect of students' Spanish.

Strengths: The class is structured at a very moderate pace which allows students to easily learn and practice the material. 
Weakness: Few chances to practice speaking Spanish with the instructor/other students

I loved this course and thought that it translated extremely well to an online situation. I loved small conversations amongst my peers and my teacher. I thought that the grammar portion of the class was extremely helpful as well.
I think the everyday workload of the course needs to be reevaluated.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Very good. Leniency on assignment submissions and about missing class due to unavoidable conflicts, etc. This class did a good job of accommodating online learning and the challenges of COVID.
Despite the circumstances, I think that the course succeeded in teaching Spanish in the best way possible. There were many opportunities to practice grammar concepts, writing, and speaking.
The three days a week really helped to not get overwhelmed sitting on Zoom in the same class  every day.

Oral presentations were assigned each week which allowed students to practice their speaking skills while presenting, but few chances were provided to encourage students to collaborate with one another.
I though that the Jamboard activities were extremely helpful and translated very well to an online setting. All conversation activities succeeded my expectations.
Meeting on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays and occasionally Tuesdays and Thursdays for exams/assessments helped mitigate zoom fatigue.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! This course offers many opportunities to better your ability to speak Spanish.
Yes; it is a standard language class that gives you the information you need to succeed in the next.
Yes, loved my professor and loved the content that we covered. Helped my Spanish a lot.
Only if you really want to learn Spanish and get to take the course w/ a good professor like Prof. Karina Lopez.
